definitions.definition: an activity or purpose natural to or intended for a person or thing.
examples: bridges perform the function of providing access across water
synonyms: role More"the main function of the machine"responsibility
business "my function was to select and train the recruits"

definitions.definition: practical use or purpose in design.
examples: building designs that prioritize style over function

definitions.definition: a basic task of a computer, especially one that corresponds to a single instruction from the user.
a relationship or expression involving one or more variables.
a variable quantity regarded in relation to one or more other variables in terms of which it may be expressed or on which its value depends.
a thing dependent on another factor or factors.
examples: class shame is a function of social power

definitions.definition: a large or formal social event or ceremony.
examples: he was obliged to attend party functions
synonyms: shindig "a function attended by local dignitaries"

definitions.definition: work or operate in a proper or particular way.
synonyms: be operative "the electrical system had ceased to function"

definitions.definition: fulfill the purpose or task of (a specified thing).
examples: the museum intends to function as an educational and study center
synonyms: do duty as "the museum functions as an educational center"
